Dialogue: (I know they are wrong . . .if my calculations are correct, our time left could be tremendously short.)
(The media is spewing lies! The danger hasn't passed yet! If only their optimism didn't prevent them from seeing reason)
Oh, didn't see you there! You're the delivery guy right? Where's my package?
You're not the delivery man? Damn it! That telescope part should have been here this morning!
Well then what the hell are you doing here? Nobody ever comes up to this place.
Never mind that, I need that package to confirm my hypothesis. Time is of the essence.
Knowing those unreliable drivers, they probably sent it to the wrong address.
I need to consult with my colleagues about this. In the mean time, can you go search for my package?
I wouldn't ask if it wasn't of the utmost importance . . . and I'll compensate you however you see fit.
It should be labelled 'For Ms. Jones'.
I fear the worst . . .
Last time this happened, a package was delivered to a house in the southern part of town.
Oh... my package. Thank you.
I receved word back, it looks like my fears are coming true. Now time to confirm the inevitable.
Alright . . . this part goes here . . . adjust the angle elevation . . . and-
Oh . . .
The star already exploded . . . we're doomed . . .
We have less than 1 minute . . .
Since this is the end, I'm at least grateful to spend these last moments doing what I love.
Even though you're young, I hope you lived a fulfulling life.
The world we know is about to vanish. Not even our memories will remain.
